item.title: Audio - Success
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Russell Johnson
item.itunes:summary: Solomon would be described as highly successful by any culture's standards, but he ultimately concluded that success has its limits. We'll look at some limitations we need to embrace and how we can live successfully by God's standards within those limitations.
item.itunes:keywords: success, limitations, contentment, struggle, achievement, Ecclesiastes 2, June 3, 2012

item.title: Audio - Pleasure
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Tim Hawks
item.itunes:summary: An endless supply of pleasure, fun, and possessions seems like a guarantee of fulfillment and perpetual happiness. But Solomon's experiment to see if he could find meaning in pleasure had a different result.

item.title: Audio - There's a Lot to See in Sodom
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Tim Hawks
item.itunes:summary: Two seemingly conflicting aspects of God's character – justice and mercy – come together in this account of the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah. How can God be just and merciful at the same time? How does He demonstrate both of these qualities in our lives?
item.itunes:keywords: justice, mercy, judgment, deliverance, prayer, choices, Genesis 18, Genesis 19, April 22, 2012

item.title: Making the Grade -- Sunday 17 January 2010
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Tim Hawks -- January 17, 2010
item.itunes:subtitle: Making the Grade -- Tim Hawks -- Genesis 4:1-16, 1 Timothy 1:12-17
item.itunes:summary: Image control management has been an issue for people since the beginning of time. We either deal with our issues honestly or we try to hide from our past issues only to find ourselves isolated and ineffective. The first step to recovering God's image in me is to acknowledge there is a God who loves and cares about us no matter what.
item.itunes:keywords: hcbc,hcbcnw,hill country bible church,hill country bible church northwest,bible,church,recovery,image control,isolation,intimacy,honesty

item.title: Doing church God's way. -- Sunday 05 October 2008
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Tim Hawks -- October 05, 2008
item.itunes:subtitle: Doing church God's way. -- Tim Hawks -- 1 Corinthians 14:26-40
item.itunes:summary:
Sermon notes: Doing Church God's Way 1 Corinthians 14:26-40
The Principles: 1. Love must govern all relationships and activities in the church. (1Cor. 8:1-3, 12;31, 13:13, 14:1)
2. Spiritual gifts are tools given by the Spirit to strengthen the faith of others. (1Cor. 13:8, 14:1, 3, 26)
3. Worship gatherings should reflect God's love for order and harMony (peace) not chaos and strife. (1Cor. 14:26, 33, 40)
The Practice: 1. Tongues must be exercised in a controlled manner.
2. Prophecy must be exercised under scrutiny. - What is prophecy? - Who decides? - What about women?
3. All must submit to the authority of God's Word.

item.title: Let's Talk Tongues -- Sunday 28 September 2008
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Tim Hawks -- September 28, 2008
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Talk Tongues -- Tim Hawks -- 1 Corinthians 13:8-14:25
item.itunes:summary:
Sermon notes:
Tongues defined:
1. A knowable language unlearned and unknown to the speaker. Acts 2:1-13 2. A supernatural gift, given to some by the Holy Spirit. 1 Cor. 12:10-11, 30 3. A spiritual gift that enable the speaker to praise God in a miraculous way. 1 Cor. 14:2, 16
Love is the governor over the use of all Spiritual Gifts. 1 Cor. 13:-14:1 1. Love is permanent - Spiritual Gifts are temporary. 2. Spiritual Gifts are tools by which we express our love.
Church worship must be understood to provde benefit. 1 Cor. 14:1-25 1. Prophecy benefits the church- tongues the individual. 2. Prophecy unites - tongues divide. 3. Prophecy evangelizes - tongues confuses.
So What: 1. If your Spiritual Gift is tongues, use it correctly. 2. If you want the Spirit's power, build up other believers.

item.title: Commissioning Video -- Church Plants -- Sun 31 August 2008
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Commissioning Video Tim Hawks -- August 31, 2008
item.itunes:subtitle: Church Plant Commissioning Video -- Tim Hawks
item.itunes:summary:
"The single most effective evangelistic methodology under heaven is planting new churches." C. Peter Wagner, Church Planting for Greater Harvest
Hill Country Bible Church is committed to effective evangelism through church planting. Since 1996 we have planted six daughter churches and cheered on the birth of Three granddaughter churches. Even with the opening of these churches there are more than 1.4 million people who still need to hear the gospel of Jesus Christ and have a church home where they will be loved, cared for, and grow spiritually.
Our church planting strategy is facilitated by the raising up of new church planters through our church planting training center. A one year residency program utilizes a personally tailored learning contract, instruction from church planting experts, exposure to best ministry practices within and outside of the Association of Hill Country Churches, practical hands on experience and coaching in specific areas of evangelism, discipleship, demographics, speaking and leadership skills in order for them to successfully plant a church by the end of the 12 Months. Church planters in the program may come from within the existing Hill Country Churches or may be found through national searches and networking. There is an annual assessment event in the spring to select the church planters for the program beginning each September.
We currently have engaged five church planters in the 2007-08 residency program, these men and their families will be our missionaries sent from HCBC to a location in Austin to effectively reach the new community by representing Jesus Christ. The church planter will be matched to an area that will fit his personality type with the essence of the new community.
Buck Giebelhaus came to Hill Country with his parents in 1986 as a teenager. While working in the corporate world, God began drawing Buck and his wife Jill's heart toward participating in the vision of HCBC in a significant way, beginning as a Small Groups Pastor in January 2007, and moving to the residency program in September. Buck and Jill have Three young sons. http://goaustin.net
Matthias Haeusel, a native German has served as a missionary in 15 nations covering 4 continents starting at the young age of 14. Serving in Pastoral roles since 2000, he most recently has been a Teaching Pastor in Lancaster, California. Married to Andrea, whom he met while they were both missionaries in Hawaii, they have four children. http://reachaustin.blogspot.com
Brannen Padgett and his wife Heather come to Texas for the church planting residency program as lifelong residents of Florida. Both have served in various capacities in new church plants in Lakeland, Florida which has given them a desire to be a part of a city reaching movement. Newly married, they are expecting their first child next spring. http://brannenpadgett.blogspot.com
Mike Shine has been the Director of the East Austin REALife Center for the past five years after serving many years as a missionary in Mexico. Mike moved to the residency program to serve in an associate pastorate role, alongside of Gene Glaeser for a new church forming in Marble Falls, Texas. Mike (center of picture) and his wife Karen have two grown children.
Jacob Vanhorn comes to us from The Village Church in Dallas, where he has been the College and Singles Pastor since 2005. Born and raised in Orange County, California, God called Jacob into ministry through a dramatic testiMony of His marvelous grace at the age of 28. Jacob and his wife Christie are the proud parents of little Caleb and are expecting baby number two in January 2008. undergraceinaustin.wordpress.com

item.title: Community: Standard or Optional? -- Sunday 17 Aug 2008
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Lance Witt -- August 17, 2008
item.itunes:subtitle: Overconfident Christians -- Lance Witt -- Ecclesiastes 4:9-12
item.itunes:summary: Is God enough? He promises to meet all our needs, (Phil. 4:19) but we don't always know how He'll accomplish that. We sometimes overlook the fact that God frequently uses other people to meet our needs. If we neglect cultivating relationships with other believers, we miss opportunities for God to fulfill our needs through them and reduce the likelihood that He'll use us in someone else's life. In this two part series, we'll look at the importance of staying connected to fellow believers and how critical that connection becomes in times of crisis.
item.itunes:keywords: hcbc,hcbcnw,hill country bible church,hill country bible church northwest,Lance Witt,bible,austin,church

item.itunes:summary: To compete in a game, there is hard work involved. For the true competitor the end goal is not simply to finish the course, but to win the race. It takes effort, setting goals, and sweating hard to make that happen. The Christian life should be no different, there is a goal ahead and it takes effort and hard work to get there. Olympic swimmer Josh Davis shares insights on what it takes to train for the Olympics and for the game of life.

When we connect with Christ, the evidence of His presence living within us is seen through our joyful service as we love one another. Study 1 John 4:7-16, and listen to Pastor Tim Hawks unfold the importance of connecting to Love's Source.
item.itunes:keywords: hcbc, hcbcnw, hill country bible church, hill country bible church northwest,tim hawks,bible,austin,1 John, Love, Trinity, Fast, Connection, Remix

item.title: The Journey to Joy -- Sunday 10 Feb 2008
item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Tim Hawks -- Feb 10 2008
item.itunes:subtitle: The Journey to Joy -- Tim Hawks -- Selected Scriptures
item.itunes:summary: Today in worship we kickoff our "LifeStyle Fast" to spend the next 28 days deepening our relationship with God and our families. The challenge is for each one of us to: (1) Spend daily time with God. (2)Spend daily time with each member of our immediate family. (3) Spend weekly time in meaningful corporate worship. (4) Spend weekly time in family devotions. Today as Pastor Tim continues our service, Remix: The Connection we'll focus on the Trinity.

item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Matthias Haeusel -- Lamentations 3:1-24
item.itunes:subtitle: God's Faithfulness -- Lamentations 3:1-24
item.itunes:summary: In the midst of life's rubble, debris and despair, how long does one see past their circumstances to view the faithful heart of a loving God? item.itunes:author: Hill Country Bible Church NW -- Dave Tilma
item.itunes:subtitle: Zaccheaus was a __ -- Selected Scripture
item.itunes:summary: God's Word is a rich tapestry of teaching, instruction and historical accounts. But how often do we rely on our recollection of what the Bible says? Are we actively seeking the face of God in His Word, or have we become satisfied with what we already know? Join us as Team Lead Pastor Dave Tilma explores what the account of Zacchaeus can deMonstrate to us today.
